item.title: Command help
item.dc:creator: @eviltwin1 eviltwin1
item.description:
@eviltwin1 wrote:

1sec, i'll sort it for you..

no the problem isnt that its not sorted i already did taht…its that when u type the ::scapest command it doesnt give u what its supposed to. it gives u the what the command above would give u.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 27, 2008, 02:04:28 PM[/size][hr]you need to change "scapest" so it doesn't start with "scapes" With codes if u have one code like scapes u cant have another beggining with the same word
ok lemme try that

Read full topic

item.title: Command help
item.dc:creator: @Random666 Random666
item.description:
@Random666 wrote:

You need to change “scapest” so it doesn’t start with “scapes”
With codes if u have one code like scapes u cant have another beggining with the same word or else the server gets confused. If u type something like ::shoods123, it’lll still be the same as ::shoods coz it has the same beggining word. Hope that helped

Read full topic

item.title: Command help
item.dc:creator: @eviltwin1 eviltwin1
item.description:
@eviltwin1 wrote:

ok well i just made a skillcape command to organize the skillcape command. the old one just gave u a jumble of them and u never knew which one ud get in each one. well anways this is it

if (command.startsWith("scapes") && playerRights >= 1) { addItem(14073,1); addItem(14076,1); addItem(14079,1); addItem(14082,1); addItem(14085,1); addItem(14088,1); addItem(14091,1); addItem(14094,1); addItem(14097,1); addItem(14100,1); addItem(14103,1); addItem(14106,1); addItem(14109,1); addItem(14112,1); addItem(14115,1); addItem(14118,1); addItem(14121,1); addItem(14124,1); addItem(14127,1); addItem(14130,1); addItem(14133,1); addItem(14136,1); addItem(14139,1); } if (command.startsWith("scapest") && playerRights >= 1) { addItem(14074,1); addItem(14077,1); addItem(14080,1); addItem(14083,1); addItem(14086,1); addItem(14089,1); addItem(14092,1); addItem(14095,1); addItem(14098,1); addItem(14101,1); addItem(14104,1); addItem(14107,1); addItem(14110,1); addItem(14113,1); addItem(14116,1); addItem(14119,1); addItem(14122,1); addItem(14125,1); addItem(14128,1); addItem(14131,1); addItem(14134,1); addItem(14137,1); addItem(14140,1); } if (command.startsWith("shoods") && playerRights >= 1) { addItem(14075,1); addItem(14078,1); addItem(14081,1); addItem(14084,1); addItem(14087,1); addItem(14090,1); addItem(14093,1); addItem(14096,1); addItem(14099,1); addItem(14102,1); addItem(14105,1); addItem(14108,1); addItem(14111,1); addItem(14114,1); addItem(14117,1); addItem(14120,1); addItem(14123,1); addItem(14126,1); addItem(14129,1); addItem(14132,1); addItem(14135,1); addItem(14138,1); addItem(14141,1); }
the problem with it is the ::scapes one works fine, and the ::shoods work fine as well but when u type the ::scapest command it gives u the contents of the ::scapes command and a few of the ::scapest command that just fills your inv. if any1 could help it would be great [br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 27, 2008, 01:57:41 PM[/size][hr]also to add the compiler has no errors in it
